member.summary: Gets the order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.ContainerResource.SelectorId
member.summary: Gets the selector Id of the item.
member.example: The format of the selector path for s doesn't follow the "prefix=value" format, and is instead just "value". For example, the value for a item might look like "segment1" where "segment1" is the Id.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Data
member.summary: This class represents the original data of an inline code. This corresponds to a <data> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.File
member.summary: This class represents a file container in an XLIFF document. This corresponds to a <file> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <file id=string [canResegment=(yes|no)] [original=string] [translate=(yes|no)] [srcDir=(ltr|rtl|auto)] [trgDir=(ltr|rtl|auto)] [xml:space=(default|preserve)] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.File.SizeInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets profile specific information to inline elements so that size information can be decoupled from the native format or represented when the native data is not available in the XLIFF document. Interpretation of the value is dependent on selected . It must represent information related to how the element it is attached to contributes to the size of the text or entity in which it occurs or represents.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.File.SizeInfoReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to data that provides the same information that could be otherwise put in a sizeInfo attribute. The reference must point to an element in a element that is a sibling to the element this attribute is attached to or a sibling to one of its ancestors.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.File.SizeRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.summary: Gets or sets the container for non-translatable content.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle whitespace.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.File.StorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the storage restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the base code of a copied code.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.EquivalentStorage
member.summary: Gets or sets a means to specify how much storage space an inline element will use in the native format. This size contribution is then added to the size contributed by the textual parts. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the equivalent storage size represented by the inline element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.FormatStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets basic formatting information using a predefined subset of HTML formatting elements. It enables the generation of HTML pages or snippets for preview and review purposes.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.HasSubFlows
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element contains sub-flow values.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the inline code.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SizeInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets profile specific information to inline elements so that size information can be decoupled from the native format or represented when the native data is not available in the XLIFF document. Interpretation of the value is dependent on selected . It must represent information related to how the element it is attached to contributes to the size of the text or entity in which it occurs or represents.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SizeInfoReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to data that provide the same information that could be otherwise put in a sizeInfo attribute. The reference must point to an element in a element that is a sibling to the element this attribute is attached to or a sibling to one of its ancestors.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SizeRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.StorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the storage restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SubFormatStyle
member.summary: Gets extra HTML attributes to use along with the HTML element declared in the FormatStyle attribute. The key is the HTML attribute name and the value is the value for that attribute.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SubType
member.summary: Gets or sets the secondary level type of an inline code.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SupportsEquivalentStorage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the EquivalentStorage property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SupportsSizeInfo
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeInfo property.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeInfoReference property.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeRestriction property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.SupportsStorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the StorageRestriction property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of an element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.CodeBase.IsLeafFragment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element represents a leaf fragment in a selector path. If so, the selector path shouldn't contain any other fragments after this fragment.

member.summary: Gets the selector Id of the item.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.SpanningCode
member.summary: This class represents a well-formed spanning original code. This corresponds to a <pc> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <pc [canCopy=(yes|no)] [canDelete=(yes|no)] [canOverlap=(yes|no)] [canReorder=(yes|no)] [copyOf=string] [dispEnd=string] [dispStart=string] [equivEnd=string] [equivStart=string] id=string [dataRefEnd=string] [dataRefStart=string] [subFlowsEnd=string] [subFlowsStart=string] [subType=string] [type=(fmt|ui|quote|link|image|other)] [dir=(ltr|rtl|auto)] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Id of the marked span.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Id of the marked span.
Plain text to add.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spanning code where this attribute is used can enclose partial spanning codes (ex. a start code without its corresponding end code, or an end code without its corresponding start code).

member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the element that contains the original data for the end marker for a given inline code.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the directionality of the content.

member.summary: Gets or sets an alternative user-friendly display representation of the original data of the end marker of an inline code.

member.summary: Gets or sets an alternative user-friendly display representation of the original data of the start marker of an inline code.

member.summary: Gets or sets a plain text representation of the original data of the end marker of an inline code that can be used when generating a plain text representation of the content.

member.summary: Gets or sets a plain text representation of the original data of the start marker of an inline code that can be used when generating a plain text representation of the content.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Note
member.summary: This class represents a note associated with elements of an XLIFF document. This corresponds to a <note> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <note [id=string] [appliesTo=(source|target)] [category=string] [priority=int] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element represents a leaf fragment in a selector path. If so, the selector path shouldn't contain any other fragments after this fragment.

member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the note.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Segment
member.summary: This class is a container that contains source text and translated text. This corresponds to a <segment> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <segment [id=string] [canResegment=(yes|no)] [state=(initial|translated|reviewed|final)] [subState=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Id of the segment.

The translation state of the segment.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the source content can be segmented.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Segment.State
member.summary: Gets or sets the translation state of the resources within the segment.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Segment.SubState
member.summary: Gets or sets the sub-state of the resources within the segment.
member.remarks: If the value is not null, the format of the value must be "prefix:value" where prefix must not be "xlf" and prefix and value must not be empty strings.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Skeleton
member.summary: This class is a container for non-translatable content. Modifiers and enrichers must not change this content. This corresponds to a <skeleton> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <skeleton [href=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Skeleton.OutputOrder
member.summary: Gets the order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. The xliff schema describes the exact order that elements and text must be output in order to be compliant. This method is used during serialization to ensure the elements and text are output in the order specified by that schema.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.SizeInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets profile specific information to inline elements so that size information can be decoupled from the native format or represented when the native data is not available in the XLIFF document. Interpretation of the value is dependent on selected . It must represent information related to how the element it is attached to contributes to the size of the text or entity in which it occurs or represents.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.SizeInfoReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to data that provide the same information that could be otherwise put in a sizeInfo attribute. The reference must point to an element in a element that is a sibling to the element this attribute is attached to or a sibling to one of its ancestors.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.SizeRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.SourceDirectionality
member.summary: Gets or sets the directionality of the source content.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.Space
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle whitespace.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.TranslationContainer.StorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the storage restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit
member.summary: This class is a container for containers that contain translatable text. This corresponds to a <unit> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <unit id=string [Name=string] [canResegment=(yes|no)] [translate=(yes|no)] [srcDir=(ltr|rtl|auto)] [trgDir=(ltr|rtl|auto)] [type=string] [xml:space=(default|preserve)] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.OutputOrderValues
member.summary: The order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.storedMatches
member.summary: Indicates whether matches were already stored to avoid storing multiple instances. The matches container is not exposed directly so it starts out empty (not null).

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.glossary
member.summary: The container for a list of glossary terms.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.originalData
member.summary: The original data for inline codes.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.resourceData
member.summary: The container for resource data associated with the enclosing element.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.translationCandidates
member.summary: The collection of matches retrieved from any leveraging system (MT, TM, etc.).

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.Unit.OutputOrder
member.summary: Gets the order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. The xliff schema describes the exact order that elements and text must be output in order to be compliant. This method is used during serialization to ensure the elements and text are output in the order specified by that schema.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Core.XliffDocument
member.summary: This class represents the root of an XLIFF 2.0 document. The document contains various containers that store resources and translatable and translated text. This corresponds to a <xliff> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <xliff version=string srcLang=string [trgLang=string] xml:space=(default|preserve) ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.OutputOrder
member.summary: Gets the order in which to write children to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. The xliff schema describes the exact order that elements and text must be output in order to be compliant. This method is used during serialization to ensure the elements and text are output in the order specified by that schema.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent element this element is hosted in. This is used to ensure that elements are not reused and cause a cycle in the data.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.Localization#Xliff#OM#IXliffDataConsumer#XliffInputOrder
member.summary: Gets the order in which to read children from a file so the input conforms to a defined schema. The xliff schema describes the exact order that elements and text must be input in order to be compliant. This method is used during deserialization to ensure the elements and text are input in the order specified by that schema.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.Localization#Xliff#OM#IXliffDataProvider#XliffOutputOrder

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.BuildSelectorPath(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs the selector path for this element.
member.param: If true, leaf elements will be included in the selector path. If false, leaf elements will be left out because another leaf element is being included in the path. Some elements may be children of other elements in the element hierarchy but in the selector path, they may reside at the same level as a leaf fragment, and this argument indicates how to handle elements in this case.
member.returns: The full path of the item from the root document.

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement.CollapseChildren(System.Type[],System.Func{Localization.Xliff.OM.XliffElement,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Collapses all the elements under this element into a list. This includes all children of this element and all their children. Only elements of the specified type are returned.
member.param: The types of children to return.

An optional method that will be called before children are added to the return list. If the method returns true for a specified child, the child may be returned along and its matching descendants. member.returns: A list of elements under the element.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.ChangeTracking.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes that provides the capability to store revision information for XLIFF elements and attributes.
member.remarks: Refer to Change Tracking Module for more information.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.ChangeTracking.ChangeTrack
member.summary: This class represents a Parent container for change tracking information associated with a sibling element, or a child of a sibling element, to the change track module within the scope of the enclosing element. This corresponds to a <changeTrack> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <changeTrack appliesTo=string [currentVersion=string] [ref=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.ChangeTracking.Item
member.summary: This class represents a container for a specific revision associated with a sibling element, or a child of a sibling element, to the change track module within the scope of the enclosing element. This corresponds to an <item> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <item property=string ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.ChangeTracking.RevisionsContainer
member.summary: This class represents a container for logical groups of revisions associated with a sibling element, or a child of a sibling element, to the change track module within the scope of the enclosing element. This corresponds to a <revisions> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <revisions appliesTo=string [ref=string] [currentVersion=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Glossary.Definition
member.summary: This class represents an optional definition in plain text for the term stored in the sibling element glossary entry. This corresponds to a <gls:definition> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <gls:definition [source=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: Gets the order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Glossary.Translation
member.summary: This class represents a translation of the sibling element expressed in the target language of the enclosing xliff element. Multiple translations can be specified as synonyms. This corresponds to a <gls:translation> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.

member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: This namespace contains classes that provides a mechanism for referencing external resource data that may need to be modified or used as contextual reference during translation.
member.remarks: Refer to Resource Data Module for more information.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.ResourceData.Reference
member.summary: This class represents a reference to contextual data relating to the sibling and elements, such as a German screenshot for a Luxembourgish translator. This corresponds to a <reference> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <reference href=string [xml:lang=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes that provides a mechanism to annotate the XLIFF content with information on storage and general size restrictions.
member.remarks: Refer to Size and Length Restriction Module for more information.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes
member.summary: This interface provides a mechanism to annotate the XLIFF content with information on storage and general size restrictions.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.EquivalentStorage
member.summary: Gets or sets a means to specify how much storage space an inline element will use in the native format. This size contribution is then added to the size contributed by the textual parts. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the equivalent storage size represented by the inline element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SizeInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets profile specific information to inline elements so that size information can be decoupled from the native format or represented when the native data is not available in the XLIFF document. Interpretation of the value is dependent on selected . It must represent information related to how the element it is attached to contributes to the size of the text or entity in which it occurs or represents.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SizeInfoReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to data that provide the same information that could be otherwise put in a sizeInfo attribute. The reference must point to an element in a element that is a sibling to the element this attribute is attached to or a sibling to one of its ancestors.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SizeRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.StorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the storage restriction to apply to the collection descendants of the element it is defined on. Interpretation of the value is dependent on the selected . It must represent the restriction to apply to the indicated sub part of the document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SupportsEquivalentStorage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the EquivalentStorage property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SupportsSizeInfo
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeInfo property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SupportsSizeInfoReference
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeInfoReference property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SupportsSizeRestriction
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the SizeRestriction property.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.ISizeRestrictionAttributes.SupportsStorageRestriction
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object supports the StorageRestriction property.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.Normalization
member.summary: This class is used to hold the attributes specifying the normalization form to apply to storage and size restrictions defined in the standard profiles. This corresponds to a <normalization> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <normalization [general=(none|nfc|nfd)] [storage=(none|nfc|nfd)]>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization form to apply for general size restrictions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization form to apply for storage size restrictions.

member.summary: This class is a container for data needed by the specified profile to check the part of the XLIFF document that is a sibling or descendant of a sibling of this element. It is not used by the default profiles. This corresponds to a <data> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <data ...>

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.SizeRestriction.Profiles
member.summary: This class selects the restriction profiles to use in the document. If no storage or general profile is specified the default values (empty) of those elements will disable restriction checking in the file. This corresponds to a <profiles> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <profiles [generalProfile=string] [storageProfile=string]>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes that provides the capability to store lists of possible translations along with information about the accuracy of the match, including similarity and quality of translation.
member.remarks: Refer to Translation Candidates Module for more information.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType
member.summary: Defines the type of a element.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.AssembledMatch
member.summary: Assembled Match: candidate generated by assembling parts of different translations.
member.example: Constructing a candidate by using the known translations of various spans of content of the source.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.IdentifierMatch
member.summary: Identifier-based Match: candidate that has an identifier identical to the one of the source content.
member.example: The previous translation of a given UI component with the same Id. match that has an identifier identical to the source content.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.InContextMatch
member.summary: In Context Match: candidate for which the content context of the translation was the same as the one of the current source.
member.example: The source text for both contents is also preceded and/or followed by an identical source segment, or both appear as e.g. level 2 headings.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.MachineTranslation
member.summary: Machine Translation: candidate generated by a machine translation system.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.Other
member.summary: Candidate of a top level type not covered by any of the above definitions.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.TermBase
member.summary: Term Base: candidate obtained from a terminological database, i.e. the whole source segment matches with a source term base entry.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.MatchType.TranslationMemory
member.summary: Translation Memory: candidate based on a simple match of the source content.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match
member.summary: This class represents a potential translation suggested for a part of the content of an enclosing element. This corresponds to a <mtc:match> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <mtc:match [id=string] [matchQuality=float] [matchSuitability=float] [origin=string] [ref=string] [reference=bool] [similarity=float] [subType=string] [type=(am|mt|icm|idm|tb|tm|other)] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.OutputOrderValues
member.summary: The order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.extensions
member.summary: The list of extensions that store custom data.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.metadata
member.summary: The container for metadata associated with the enclosing element.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.originalData
member.summary: The original data for inline codes.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.source
member.summary: The source content to be translated.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.target
member.summary: The translated content.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.HasReferenceTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the child of the element contains a translation into a reference language rather than into the target language. For example, a German translation can be used as reference by a Luxembourgish translator.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.IsLeafFragment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element represents a leaf fragment in a selector path. If so, the selector path shouldn't contain any other fragments after this fragment.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.MatchQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the quality of the child of a element based on an external benchmark or metric.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.MatchSuitability
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the general suitability and relevance of its element based on various external benchmarks or metrics pertaining to both the and the children of the .

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Metadata
member.summary: Gets or sets the container for metadata associated with the enclosing .

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the Name of a tool, system, or repository that generated a element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.OriginalData
member.summary: Gets or sets the original data for inline codes.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.OutputOrder
member.summary: Gets the order in which to write data to a file so the output conforms to a defined schema. The xliff schema describes the exact order that elements and text must be output in order to be compliant. This method is used during serialization to ensure the elements and text are output in the order specified by that schema.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.SelectorId
member.summary: Gets the selector Id of the item.
member.example: For a item, this value might look like "mtc=match1" where "match1" is the Id.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.SelectorPath
member.summary: Gets the full path of the item from the root document.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Similarity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the similarity level between the content of the child of a element and the translatable text being matched.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the portion of the text to be translated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to to a span of source text within the same , to which the translation candidate is relevant.

member.summary: Gets or sets the secondary level type of a element. This property is set in conjunction with Type.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.TranslationCandidates.Match.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of a element, it gives the value providing additional information on how the match was generated or qualifying further the relevance of the match. The list of pre-defined values is general and user-specific information can be added using the SubType property.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes that defines a specific set of validation rules that can be applied to target text both globally and locally. Further constraints can be defined that allow rules to be applied to target text based on conditions in the source text or disabled to override a global scope.
member.remarks: Refer to Validation Module for more information.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule
member.summary: This class represents a specific rule and constraint to apply to the target text of the enclosing element. This corresponds to a <rule> element in the XLIFF 2.0 specification.
member.example: A sample XLIFF fragment looks like: <rule [caseSensitive=(yes|no)] [disabled=(yes|no)] [endsWith=string] [existsInSource=(yes|no)] [isNotPresent=string] [isPresent=string] [normalization=(none|nfc|nfd)] [occurs=number] [startsWith=string] ...>
member.remarks: See the XLIFF specification for more details.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.extensions
member.summary: The list of extensions that store custom data.

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.CaseSensitive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the test defined within the rule is case sensitive (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the rule must (false) or must not (true) be applied within the scope of its enclosing element.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.EndsWith
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates a text must end with the specified value.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.ExistsInSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the condition must be satisfied in both the source and target. This value is only valid when used in conjunction with one of IsPresent, StartsWith, or EndsWith.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Localization#Xliff#OM#Extensibility#IExtensible#Extensions
member.summary: Gets the list of registered extensions on the object.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Localization#Xliff#OM#Extensibility#IExtensible#HasExtensions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether extensions are registered on the object.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.IsNotPresent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a string must not be present in the target text.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.IsPresent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a string must be present in the target text.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Normalization
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization form to apply when validating a rule.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Occurs
member.summary: Gets or sets the exact number of times a string must be present in the target text. When this value is false, then the string must be present in the target text at least once. This value is only used in conjunction with IsPresent.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.StartsWith
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates a text must start with the specified value.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Localization#Xliff#OM#Extensibility#IExtensible#SupportsAttributeExtensions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether attribute extensions are supported by the object.

member.name: P:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.Validation.Rule.Localization#Xliff#OM#Extensibility#IExtensible#SupportsElementExtensions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether element extensions are supported by the object.

member.name: T:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.NormalizationValue
member.summary: Defines the values that indicate the unicode normalization form.
member.remarks: Refer to Unicode Normalization Forms for more information.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.NormalizationValue.None
member.summary: Indicates no normalization should be done.

member.name: F:Localization.Xliff.OM.Modules.NormalizationValue.NFC
member.summary: Indicates Normalization Form C (Canonical Decomposition, followed by Canonical Composition) must be used.

member.summary: Include all elements at all levels of the hierarchy.

member.summary: This interface indicates that an object can be used to navigate a selection query. The object may be a selection target (implements ) or it contains children that are selection targets.

member.summary: Selects an item matching the selection query.
member.param: The selection query.
member.returns: The object that was selected from the query path, or null if no match was found.
member.example: The value of might look something like "#g=group1/f=file1/u=unit1/n=note1" which is a relative path from the current object, not a full path from the document root.

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.Utilities.IsValidNMTOKEN(System.String,System.Exception@)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the given name conforms to the NMTOKEN standard.
member.param: The name to validate.
If validation fails, this will contain the exception that is thrown by the validator.
member.returns: True if the name conforms to a valid NMTOKEN, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.Utilities.IsWellFormedSelectorPathExcludingResourceStrings(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified path represents a well-formed selector path excluding resource strings and inline tags. The actual path is not validated, just the structure of it.
member.param: The path to examine.
member.returns: True if the path represents a well-formed selector path, false if it does not.
member.remarks:
Resource strings and inline tags don't require a prefix, nor do they support extensions so validating those requires more knowledge about the XliffElements and isn't done here.
This method does not validate that the path is actually valid. For instance, it doesn't validate that a path looks like "#/f=f1" rather than "#/foo=bar" (ie. the root fragment MUST be a file). Instead, this method just looks for paths of the form: expression ::= "#" ["/"] selector {selectorSeparator selector} selector ::= prefix prefixSeparator id prefix ::= NMTOKEN id ::= NMTOKEN prefixSeparator ::= "=" selectorSeparator ::= "/"

member.name: M:Localization.Xliff.OM.Utilities.IsValidXmlCodePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks to see if a Unicode code point represents a symbol that is safe to include in an XML file.
member.param: Code point to verify.
member.returns: true - code point represents a symbol that can be included in an XML file, false - code point needs to be escaped before including it.
